returns.para: Returns a pointer to the current process parameters.

remarks.para: XAPOs must call this method within their implementation to access the current process parameters in a thread-safe manner.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Creates an instance of the CXAPOParametersBase class.

param.name: pRegistrationProperties
param.para: A pointer to an structure that contains the registration properties for the XAPO.

param.name: pParameterBlocks
param.para: Pointer to three contiguous process parameter blocks used for synchronization.

param.name: uParameterBlockByteSize
param.para: Size of a parameter block in pParameterBlocks.

param.name: fProducer
param.para: If TRUE, indicates produces data to be returned by and disallows calls to .

remarks.para: All process parameter blocks in pParameterBlocks must be initialized to the same default value before there is a call to the , , and methods. Usually this initialization should be handled in or in .
The object created by this CXAPOParametersBase will have a reference count of 1.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Notifies CXAPOParametersBase that the XAPO has finished accessing the current process parameters.

remarks.para: XAPOs must call this method within their implementation to access the current process parameters in a thread-safe manner.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Called by to allow for user-defined parameter validation.

remarks.para: Users are expected to use asserts for parameter validation in OnSetParameters.

The CXAPOParametersBase class's implementation of validates that ParameterByteSize is equal to the m_uParameterBlockByteSize private member before calling OnSetParameters so it may be assumed that ParameterByteSize == m_uParameterBlockByteSize. m_uParameterBlockByteSize will be equal to the uParameterBlockByteSize parameter passed into the constructor.
This method should not block as it is called from the realtime audio processing thread.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Indicates if has been called since the last processing pass.

returns.para: Returns TRUE if has been called since the last processing pass. May only be used within the XAPO's implementation, before is called.

remarks.para: Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)
